thread.title: North Korea to send athletes to next month's Paralympics in South Korea: report

title: North Korea to send athletes to next month's Paralympics in South Korea: report
text: February 27, 2018 / 9:36 AM / Updated 7 hours ago North Korea to send athletes to next month's Paralympics in South Korea: report Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SEOUL (Reuters) - North Korea plans to send athletes to compete in next month’s Paralympic Games in South Korea, following its high profile participation in the Olympic games that wrapped up on Sunday, Yonhap news agency said. Officials from North and South Korea met on Tuesday at a village along the heavily fortified border to discuss logistics for the Paralympics, which begin on March 7. South Korean leaders see Pyongyang’s participation in the Games as key to lowering tensions on the peninsula and possibly leading to diplomatic negotiations over the North’s nuclear program. Reporting by Heekyong Yang; Editing by Clarence Fernandez
